metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3569 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A stack corruption bug was found in libtpms in versions before 0.7.2 and before 0.8.0 while decrypting data using RSA. This flaw could result in a SIGBUS (bad memory access) and termination of swtpm. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3569` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtpms0 - 0.8.2-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libtpms package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.8.2-1ubuntu1').
